Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Sweney "SweneysBattlefieldAc"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today it is easy to use and navagate. The touchscreen works well with fingers as wellas the included stylus (i put it on the hand strap for easy access) The stylus works good when logging into facebook, youtube, photobucket and the many other available places to share your photos. I uploaded a picture to facebook with relative ease.I liked the auto backup too, you can backup your pictures to a Pc without connecting the camera to the Pc (awesome!!)The picture quality is great too!The video mode supports HD 720p i havent tried it yet but its HD! I suggest this camera to anyone looking for an easy to use point and click camera with some kick ass extras like the ability to touch up / edit photos before u send them on their way to FB or wherever you send them!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Still has Work to Do
Reviews.Author: thirdnormal
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and used it extensively on a two week trip to Europe. Overall I am happy with it, it took great pictures and was pretty easy to use.I LOVE the fact that you can charge the battery without taking it out of the camera (Like the way you charge a cell phone). No need for a separate charger, so one less piece of gear to lug around. The benefit of this  also means you can charge it on an as-needed basis (I charged it through the power outlet in the rental car I was driving). This was the key feature that drove my purchase decision, and its strange that it doesn't get mentioned much in the marketing literature since it's a major advantage over the competition.The touch screen interface is a disappointment though. If you are used to a smart phone type touch screen then this screen will seem slow and clunky. It feels more like a PDA from 2004 than a smart phone from 2011. Also, putting all the controls on the touch screen makes for some usability issues. I would prefer to see physical buttons for commonly used operations like turning the flash on and off. A camera is a dedicated device so should be optimized for common photography use cases.The wireless connectivity was pretty cool, but again suffered usability issues. Connecting to wireless networks was a pain with the clunky touch screen. This is a long way from an iPhone or Android OS. Also, there doesn't seem to be any control over the name of the album or the subject of the facebook post. The wireless connectivity is is a very cool idea, but it still has some way to go before being truly compelling.At the end of the day I think my money was well spent. Samsung is on to a good thing and I hope they continue evolving this product line.

Reviews.Title: Great potential held back by quirky software
Reviews.Author: Clayton R.
Reviews.Content: I just received my SH100 today, so I won't try to do a full in-depth review. However, in the hours that I've played with it I can already tell that there are quite a few 'quirks' that seriously hinder an otherwise great camera.First, the camera comes with a touchscreen interface for most of the functions. Sadly, it also comes with a stylus which, in my experience, isn't optional to use in many situations (such as typing) - at least with my large fingers. Even worse - there isn't a place to store the stylus within the camera itself. Instead, it clips and hangs awkwardly from the lanyard. While a generally small nuisance (and perhaps a non-issue for those with smaller fingers), it would have been much nicer if the screen was sensitive enough to work via touch or there were discreet navigation buttons.The biggest issue for me, however, has to be the software running on the camera. The UI isn't very pretty and is awkwardly organized. It feels very hastily thrown together. Again, this is a minor disappointment, but something that should have been easy to fix. Unfortunately, that isn't all. The software is also quite buggy! I had found several issues within the first few minutes (where was the QC?!) which took hours to resolve. For one thing, logging in to Picasa was a real pain as there were issues with the software recognizing both my email address AND password. The login for Picasa should be the same as my Google login. However, my account is associated with several email addresses and only one of them was accepted for some reason (and it wasn't my normal gmail.com account, it was a tertiary address I rarely use). Even worse - there's a serious bug in the password handling that prevents it from recognizing a password with any special characters! As best I can tell, only numbers and letters will work as they should. If you enter a password with a special character the password will not be accepted. This was a real problem for me as I did not want to change my password (I use many different Google services across many devices, and changing the login credentials on all of them would be a real headache!) Fortunately, I discovered an undocumented workaround/hack. If you change special characters to URL encoding (so pa$$word becomes pa%24%24word) it will work (even though it really shouldn't!) Unfortunately, this seems to prevent the password from being stored properly (only characters up to the first % are stored!). So far I have only tried logging in to the Picasa service, but I suspect these issues are present in all password fields and may well extend to user names, etc.To be fair, the camera has some really great features and it takes very nice pictures for the price. In fact, it really could be an AMAZING camera if they ever get the software straightened out. Unfortunately, until new firmware is released, this camera has fallen fairly short of its potential.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade your firmware!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Holth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the Engadget recommendation, because the camera records video in H.264 instead of the horribly inefficient motion JPEG, and for the cool WiFi feature. When it arrived I was impressed at how small it is but the menu system seemed to crash a lot or become unresponsive.It turns out this camera has a firmware update from July 29, 2011. I wasn't able to upgrade the firmware with the included (on the camera's internal storage) software; you should try to do it that way, but instead, I copied the contents of the firmware .zip to the root of the Micro SD card. After upgrading the firmware the camera's menu system is much more usable.Pros: Compact size, H.264 movie mode, never have to plug it into the computer to get the photos off due to the WiFi, large, bright touchscreenCons: Flash takes 5-10 seconds to charge after taking a photo, works best in outdoor light, doesn't use a standard USB cable

Reviews.Title: Truly stands out
Reviews.Author: Ruslan Moskalenko "Ruslan Moskalenko"
Reviews.Content: My pretty daughter was looking for a little camera to take on her DC trip and obviously my big SLR was out of question. So we went to a store to do some shopping. I left her alone for a few mins and asked her to find something she likes. When I got back she said she chose this camera. Well, I told her she'd better check out Canons or Nikons because they are great cameras and who knows about Samsung. But I really got puzzled because I just couldn't convince her they are better. And after some thinking we ended up buying this Samsung camera.This camera is really special for 2 reasons.First is touchscreen. These days touch is the de-facto standard interface for mobile devices, so once you've tried a touchscreen camera it feels natural and going through menues with buttons really feels awkward. At one moment the Canon and Nikon menus became annoying. Yes, there is a stylus mostly for virtual keyboard but you can really get by with just fingers most of the times. So touchscreen does make big difference.Second is connectivity. The camera comes with Wi-Fi and it has built-in software to post pictures on facebook and some other popular services. And you can upload pictures wirelessly to your computer. No cables. This is a big deal.So is this camera a sure buy? Well, it's a bit more compicated. This camera is really trying to be a compromise between a "real" camera and a smart phone. In a "real" cameras land this camera is good but not the best. There are competitors out there with slightly better specs (like 1080HD instead of 720HD etc) but arguably you'll unlikely to notice a significant difference - any "pro" camera needs at least a bigger lense and heavier weight to capture a better image to begin with.Basically if you really like touchscreen and wireless you should seriously think if you'd rather buy a good smart phone. Yes, I can't think of any smartphone with 14MP, 5x Zoom, a 720p HD and a "real" flash, but does it justify carrying two devices? My daughter was saying that this is a big trip and she wants to capture the lifetime moments and she ended up with a smartphone and this camera (so hard to say no to an adorable daughter ...) but when we looked at the pictures she brought back, they are not really much different from her smartphone ones. So yes, with some skills you can do miracles with the camera but for most ordinary people and real life shots the results will be about the same. I mean you're unlikely to print a huge poster and a typical computer screen has <2MP anyway.So bottom line is, this is a good camera with some really outstanding features, it's really great feel and fun expirience, something making other competitors looks dull and boring. But if those new features make you so excited, you should consider a good smartphone, maybe that is what you really need.

Reviews.Title: good and the bad and the reason why it misses being as close to perfect for a Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Berger "Liberals destroyed my education I ...
Reviews.Content: OK I have a professional camera (canon rebel xs with the digic III proc)  I also have a Canon sd890is and three models before in the same series the 890 I could take a photo of someone closing their eyes in a great shot and take them from another as the photo quality was that good and paste them into the other with Photoshop.  THIS CAMERA has several issues above and beyond the image quality that make it less then ideal for a a serious photo snapper in a casual or serious environment.PROS:Body construction, nice  half powder coated steel have plastic but slim and durableLots of features (although most of which are not executed where the end result is a great picture)Macro Photo Quality:  GREAT super my Russian peterbald who is hairless to the naked eye actually as tiny tiny fuzz that is visible in a BROAD DAYLIGHT macro shot (not a dimly lit room shot)Self Portrait shots *lack detail and blur and auto correct only good for you know self shots not print quality or suchCONS: (and there are lots)due to the large size of the screen and no view finder so that you can turn it off and take photos that way to conserve battery like my old Cannon and new Canon Rebel xs, you are forced to hold the very small right side of the camera that has but one button and if you have large hands you will surely drop this camera unless you do the two hand photo taking thing.WHEN doing this:The camera heats up within 4 minutes that it is noticeable in a cold room so if it where summer or anywhere warm this would surely intensify, for the record, my canon sd890 which is years older and has a large battery and all powder coated steel frame would get this hot after HOURS OF USE not 4 minutes.TOUCH SCREEN:  The touch screen as some say is less responsive then current smart phones. However, it does work just find when you realize that to touch a menu you button you much touch dead center not the corner, the side, somewhere around it, you have to press it dead on and firmly not lightly.  That being said sometimes when you do it may or may not recognize the touch if you do it quickly it must be done slowly and firmly.VIDEO:  Testing in my room with natural light coming in from the window with my old camera and this one, the difference is 2011 and 1980, the video on this camera is  choppy at best my old old cell phone takes better video. That being said I did not test it outdoors in natural light and for that based on the cameras performance I am sure it would do fine fir most consumersPICTURE QUALITY:OK this is a multi part statement.Macro setting as stated above in natural bright light is excellentAuto Smart Setting aka what most refer to as just Auto, for lack of a better phrase sucks.  No matter what setting picture size the auto setting crops photos, lacks accurate consistent focus and is really bad on zoom as far as photo quality, I also tried the powershot elph 300 and even that had a better all around even though it was eh on the details in the photos and softened them.Night Mode: This mode has many settings but unless you have a VERY VERY VERY VERY steady hand or a tripod it is basically useless the photos come out blurred not in focus remotely or nothing distinguishable because you see the screen says processing complete and it wasn'tSelf Portrait Shots called Beauty Mode on the camera : Now if you want to take a photo of yourself and you want it to be a quality photo this is not the camera HOWEVER, if you have dry skin like I do on your face or a pimple and you take a photo of yourself with this camera YOU WILL NOT SEE ONE BLEMISH OR MARK! so if you are less then flawless bare face without makeup and need to send a guy or girl a shot of you then this is the camera you WANT!!!! however I can photoshop anything dont believe in being dishonest because the person will see you face to face without makeup eventually and you would have to explain what happened to your flawless complexion. WHen taking a face shot in beauty mode  it makes your skin look great but detail from hair and your eye color go the way of the dodo bird, again just in general not recommended unless you want to take photos without makeup and still look human.I have tried 4 2010-2011 point and shoot models 2 I got from Costco as that is where I bought all of my great performance point and shot cameras and then this being the 2nd from Amazon.  It seems to me that no matter what brand that any camera that has above 10 megapixels (which is sufficient for photo editing by the way as previously mentioned) that anything above this 10 Megapixel that combines with a digic 4 processor EVERY photo has lossssssssss of detail.I really want a point and shoot that I can carry around with me and also use indoors to take candids of my Russian Peterbalds and friends etc and video on the fly of my baby cousins that is good quality and I am desperate to find something of equal quality to my old canon powershot elph sd 890is or better as it is on it very last limbs from constant constant dropping lol, yet I am unable to find a suitable replacement that is equivalent or superior........:(

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Jacob D Ford
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera b/c of all the features described and i love the touch screen on my iphone. Big mistake. features are not great. the auto feature is nice but it takes so long for the camera to decide what mode to shoot in that the moment has passed or people have moved. kPictures turned out blury and very pixalated. The touch screen is aweful! nothing like the iphone touch screen. I returned this item within a week of having it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Honest Answer
Reviews.Content: YOU MUST GET AN SD CARD TO EVEN USE THIS CAMERA....SO ORDER ONE WHEN YOU ORDER THE CAMERA OR BUY ONE BEFORE IT ARRIVES!  And with that the only bad thing I can say about this camera is that it comes incomplete.  Once you have an sd micro chip it is point and shoot.  Great pictures and if you love to upload pictures all you need to do is get in a wifi friendly zone and you are good to go.  Small, easy to use and quality pictures.  The stylus that comes with the camera will save you some fat finger frustration when dealing with the menus.  I loved this camera from the moment I picked it up.  Download the manual and it will take about 20 minutes to get up to speed on the cameras features.  Enjoy this little wonder and it's fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: samsung Sh100 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Wotherspoon
Reviews.Content: My sister had this camera and I had to get one too.  It is an amazing camera for the price.  The picture resolution is outstanding.  It is very compact and fits into a pocket or purse without a problem.  The battery last for a long time and is charged from your computer or plugged into a socket.  It has 5X zoom and it has several options from the touch screen menu.  I use it on the smart mode and get great pictures.  It has wi fi and I like loading pictures on FB without using an computer or phone.  I have enjoyed this camera very much.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but missing one thing...
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: First off this camera takes AMAZING pictures! It posts to facebook and all those other things pretty easily, but it does not remember your login info and you have to constantly type it in. the biggest problem I have had is that you can only send pictures set at 2MP so you cannot get the full use of the 14MP if you want to send them via the camera's built in WiFi. The other issue I have run into is that you CANNOT post to a company facebook page with the WiFi setting at all. Not sure where the software probelm is (it could be FB or the camera's) but you can only post to a personal FB account. Some more software developement and it will be the perfect point and shoot camera. One other thing is that the screen is a bit difficult to use because it is more of a press screen then a touch screen. Sometimes it makes the sound of taking your touch, but make sure it actually shows up on the screen. Like I said great pics, but needs a little refinement.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Aileen
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is extremely easy to navigate through. And the wifi feature is awesome. It's very convenient to be able to directly upload the pictures from your camera. Also, you can edit your photos before uploading. I would recommend this camera for people who enjoy taking A LOT of pictures to capture every moment. I wouldn't recommend it for video usage.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy
Reviews.Author: Aquarianqueen
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung SH100 just before going on a short vacation and it was allowed me to share lots of exciting pictures with my friends and family. The WIFI worked from my hotel room and during my spare time I was able to upload my photos to facebook.I then bought my niece as a graduating gift and she too was wowed with hers.Thanks Samsung for making the SH100.

Reviews.Title: Great price and Great work

Reviews.Content: I got this camera before i went on the trip to Thailand ... great camera with a lot of funtion. The most i like it's very easy to sent email or post on Facebook with out connection to computer any where that have Wifi u can connect too.

They tend to be either fuzzy and/or the colors are washed out.  I got it primarily b/c of the wifi feature -- and that seems to work ok.  Again, it could just be that I'm not far enough down the learning curve quite yet.Oh - and note that I'm fairly technical (wife always calls me a geek) - so it's not b/c I'm an idiot.

Reviews.Title: its great

Reviews.Content: It is just what I expected and my daughter loves it!  She can post right to facebook or email pics too right fromn the camera with ease!

Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today.Like I am totally pleased with this gadget.My SONY T-90 died when the screen went blank.This camera has loads of bells and is easy to use.I am still having a problem loggind on to utbe but its a password thing.The WIFI is great and connected without a hitch.I purchased this refurb item and its on the money.My Sony cameras seem obselete compared to this one.I'll see what their DSLRs look like.Good buy and I saved a bundle.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera

Reviews.Content: For a pocket camera this is really good, touchscreen, wifi. Maybe the only  thing that I would be see is a better optical zoom (7x at least, an a little large screen). But for that price a really good camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures. With the 14mp sensor, you can really enlarge and show great detail. The stylus works pretty well on the touch screen. Mine, though, has some trouble responding to the stylus when I try to click on one side of the screen. I have to click a few times in that area, once for the other side. Weird!

Reviews.Title: Terrible in low light situations
Reviews.Author: C. Young "Janna Banana"
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take pictures of my childrens' performances for school.  This camera is awful!  Maybe I am doing something wrong, but I've had it for a year now and I cannot get a decent picture indoors.  Also, it is so incredibly SLOW!!!  I do not recommend this product if you need it for mostly indoor shots.If anybody has a recommendation on an affordable digital camera that does good in low light situations, I would appreciate your feedback!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a basic user
Reviews.Author: James Tyndall
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife. She's starting to get into some digital photography and wanted a small unit she could keep in her purse/pocket/whatever. I selected it because it's a Samsung product (big fan of these folks) and a number of features, in particular the program modes, WiFi, and the ability to upload from the camera directly over WiFi to Facebook, Picasa, and others.After she used it for a couple of days, she admitted it wasn't really growing on her. The charge speed of the flash was her first complaint...it does take a while for the flash to power up enough to discharge, so she missed a few shots she'd like to have had. The complexity of the menu structure was her next complaint. The thing is PLENTY configurable, but it's not very clear exactly what you're doing as you try to tune the various settings. There's documentation on the CD that comes with it, but lugging around a laptop so you can read up on what everything means is impractical.I don't dislike the camera, and would recommend it for someone who is looking for a basic camera. The WiFi and Facebook uploads make it a nifty camera for maybe a student or traveler looking to document their journey.But don't try to get a flash-lit shot on a dime...you'll end up missing something.

Reviews.Title: Wifi camera at an affordable cost!

Reviews.Content: have not given it as a Christmas present as of yet...tried it out and it is high quality...  Not sure how functional the stylus will work...

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Good little Camera.

Reviews.Title: Freezes when using smart movie mode
Reviews.Author: VJK
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for about 9 months.  I could never get the wi-fi to connect to my computer but it wasn't that big of a deal to plug it in.  About a month ago it started freezing up when I used Smart Movie Mode.  I tried a different SD card, hoping that would help but it didn't.  The pictures are ok, but not great.  The menu's are a little complicated for the manual controls.  The touch screen is hit and miss with accepting input.  Overall, I'm pretty disappointed in the camera and will probably avoid Samsung in the future.

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!  Anything else would be superfluous!
Reviews.Author: roaeja "Hey you!"
Reviews.Content: Anything I say would be superfluous.  Who caresif it has a miniSD?  It has wifi.  The different gadgets built inwill keep you busy for a long time.I can now talk to my Samsung 2012 LED 3D tv, with all thegadgets and Allshare.  Take a picture and boom, it showsup on my tv.  To bad it doesn't have a built in slot for a sims card?  Hmmm, Samsung?  All the other cameras I have arenow obsolete.  THANK YOU SAMSUNG FOR A GREAT CAMERA....Job well done.I love the 'Remote Viewfinder' gadget!  You can use an iPad,touch cellphone with Android gadget 'Remote Viewfinder'to remotely access and control your camera, via a homewifi network.  You could monitor your baby from roomsaway and take pictures at the same time!  This is reallya cool feature.Now it is down to $87!  What a steal.  BUT, I'm orderingthe more expensive one: Samsung WB150F 14.2-megapixelDigital Camera.  I'm hoping it will have betterzoom focus.  This one has a tendency to have a soft focus.Wait and see.  I may keep both of them.I'm very surprised that Samsung doesn't offer 'remote viewfinder' formy 55ES8000 Smart LED tv, so I could use it as a monitor for thiscamera.  It appears the right hand, doesn't know what the lefthand is doing.  Allshare works fine, but I have to use my iPad asa monitor.  :-(After buying the Samsung WB150F 14.2-megapixel Digital Cameraand comparing it to this one, I'm sending the WB150F BACK!  Thisis just point, touch and clink, snap, crackle, pop...you're done.This is the easies camera I have ever used.  In bright sunlight, itis like any other 3" screen, little hard to see.  But hey, all camerashas that drawback.  You won't be disappointed.  Sue me if you are.I love the Samsung Remote Viewfinder gadget + iPad for monitoringit.  I put the camera outside and walked down to the end of mydriveway, it still worked.  You can go as far as your home wifi area.You want to monitor something, just set it up!  This is one sweet camera.You can also do camera to camera.  Take a picture and send it to anothercamera, call sharing.  If you are married, you should buy two or more forthe whole family.Update: I love this camera.  It is the ONLY one I've found that will Allshare with my Samsung LCD tv, pictures come right up on the screen or I can send them to my Facebook account.  Or I can use my iPad3 as a remote monitor and put the camera anywhere to transmit an image.  It does 720P which is just as good as 1080i.  Plus it is touchscreen and the battery last forever.  Plus it will fit inside your shirt pocket.  This is a great camera and cheap, too.  Plus it will send picture to other FH100 cameras. The only thing lacking is a cellphone built in.  For a good, all around, fun camera, this is it.  If you own a Samsung tv, much better.

Reviews.Title: Not enough quality
Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: Actually I expected the quality of pictures to be better. The photo quality was slightly better than my Nokia 5800's. And seems the box was opened.. It doesn't really looked like a new. So, I'm a bit dissapointed with this camera. Touchscreen, and everything is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Welch "m.w"
Reviews.Content: it takes really sharp and clear pictures,and the video is really good nice and clear and the wifi is a big plus it comes with cool features great camera for the price..

Reviews.Title: buy it on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Deeva
Reviews.Content: I bought mine at Best Buy and paid too much but I was trading in my gift, the Nikon Cool Pic 9100 for a camera that was easier to operate and I wanted the WiFi for uploading ease to Facebook, YouTube and to email.  So far I really love it though I didnt get a card with it but I had my card from the Nikon so I thought I was good to go. I wasnt...it takes a mini card and it did not come with it so I am off again tomorrow to buy a card. Other than that  I have no complaints yet.....the pictures are not blurry (I cant say the same for the Nikon).  I have a bit of learning to do but the online manual is nice and I look forward to playing with my options :)  Ill give a user report later...for now, if you are looking for user friendly, this may be your camera.

Reviews.Title: Samsung SH100...Good, but software/firmware Not for Macbooks
Reviews.Author: Meggaboo
Reviews.Content: Well I got the camera today. I loved everything about it. The wifi came with the camera and it took a mini sd card. It comes in red and black which is great, b/c Ir love red. It has 4 different menus on the homescreen to chose from. Just like icons or apps for Iphone or Androids. I like that. It came w CD-ROM and inside the camera itself has the firmware. Problem is, I have a Mac and not Windows. So it was no good to me. Thank goodness I have IPhoto. You can go ahead and fix or edit your pics on the camera itself. But nothing is like having it on the screen of a laptop lookin at all the imperfections. It has this one Icon on the homescreen called Beauty Shot...very cool and wonderful for girls. HD video is a nice touch, and so is 14.2 megapix. For the price, gettin all of the bells and whistles in one lil package, really is great. I would defiantly recommend this to a friend or family member. And also remember...you get what you paid for folks. But this is worth the money. :)

Reviews.Title: My Nickname for the Camera: THE DUD
Reviews.Author: Laura Freed "Happiness Activist"
Reviews.Content: I initially bought this because I was excited to be able to upload pictures to Facebook and thru email using the camera. But there were so many steps to take, that I quickly abandoned that idea. For me, that was a dud.Next dud - all the different menus and options - I could never remember which button did what - and I take ALOT of pictures of food in restaurants - they almost always came out horrible. It would take forever to find the right "setting" (automatic was a joke - took horrible indoor shots). If I tried using the flash - all I got was a crappy shot that never did the food I was taking a picture of any justice.Now, taking outdoor pictures was usually always fine, no problems - until it started snapping blurry pictures - ALL THE TIME! Another Dud - I'd have to wait forever between a shot.The final dud - half the time it would turn on by itself if I tossed it in my purse because the ON/OFF button protrudes and it's easy to accidentally bump it.I finally gave in and bought a different camera (Sony Cybershot) which was cheaper and it is so EASY and takes 100% better pictures. I learned how to use that in about an hour whereas I spent a whole summer trying to learn how to use the Samsung until I finally gave up.I am not a techy/camera person - so perhaps I was doing something wrong - but if you are buying this and you are as "clueless" as I am, you might want to consider something else.

Reviews.Title: You like your Android type Phones?  You will love this Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Shatsoff "Motivation"
Reviews.Content: Me who buys everything through Amazon bought her's on a whim buy at hhGregg for $50.00 more and no extra accessories.  This deal offers you everything that I just came on Amazon to see!  I love this camera, I have had it a week and taken over 60 pics of my grandson's and 4 video's.  The remote back up and sending pictures to facebook and e-mail right from the camera makes this as nice as taking from you smart phone except these are perfect.  I have to admit although I could take pictures and do the basics, reading the manual I can do all types of great tricks.  I recommend this camera to anyone who likes toys!  I bought it for an upcoming trip that I knew I would want to send pic's of right away.Buy here and with the options they give you you will save close to $100.00.Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Great graduation gift

Reviews.Content: This was a graduation gift for our grandson. He is really into computers and state of the art products. Let me say he just loved the camera. He shot video out the window of our truck right away and took many stills of family and friends. All came out fantastic for such a small camera. It was purchased so he could take it on his trip to Alaska where he is staying with his uncle. He has posted many beautiful pictures of his trip on YouTube. He just loves it!

Reviews.Title: Strike 3 Samsung
Reviews.Author: SMC
Reviews.Content: Camera feels flimsy and cheap.  Videos look terrible, as if some kind of put through a lossy compression algorithm.  Touch screen is INCREDIBLY unresponsive and annoying to use.  Taking a picture is a gamble, you can press, hold, and hold and hold and nothing will happen, ruining lots of great shots with its inconsistency.  Together with a lousy DVD/VCR combo and a way way overrated LCD monitor with the worst color balance I have ever seen, Samsung has joined my short ban list.

Reviews.Title: So far I love it. AND NOW? I HATE IT
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Deneuve Hall "Suzanne"
Reviews.Content: OF course, it arrived today and I haven't even used it! I love the look. First out of the box, I had a difficult time with the touch screen until I realized you HAVE TO USE THE SYLUS provided, then it's all cake!I'm wondering after reading the literature, and some users comments...about connecting to WiFi. If you HAVE WiFi at home, do you need Boingo? Because Boingo Charges:Boingo Unlimited Enjoy unlimited Wi-Fi access throughout the Americas on any two Wi-Fi enabled devices for $9.95 each month.  Wi-Fi connections made outside the Americas will be billed an additional $0.12 or $0.18 per minute.  Boingo Unlimited is a recurring charge, but you can change your plan at any time.Boingo AsYouGo Enjoy 24 hours of Wi-Fi access on this device at this hotspot for $7.95. Plus, use your Boingo account to stay connected at hundreds of thousands of hotspots worldwide; prices vary by location.Boingo Global - Combo Enjoy up to 2,000 minutes of Wi-Fi access per month on your laptop or smartphone at Boingo hotspots worldwide for only $59 USD per month. Please note, this is a recurring subscription, but Boingo is flexible, so you can change your plan at any time.WHICH seems a BIT PRICEY TO ME. I guess I will find out!I'll update as I go. : )UPDATE: It's a poor first leap for Samsung. You will be lucky if you can ever figure out how to connect your home wifi to it. After the three free months of hotspot wifi, you'll need to pay 7.99 month. There is no drag and drop of picture files, so don't expect to be able to move them around on your computer. No Burn to Dvd or Cd capability. No instructions on how to do or set up much of anything. I've had it two weeks and haven't figured out how to be able to set up home wifi, Samsung is useless at replies, my phone company tech support helped as much as they could, but still Nothin. It's a great concept, but it's limited and impossible to figure out. You have to upload to Picasa to burn CDs and DVDs, it's a royal pain in the butt!!! I'm shipping mine back to Windstream which is our phone company, I bought it through a promo they had. Must have been to help Samsung unload them!

Reviews.Title: The best camera she as ever owned.. and i got the brownie points

After getting it and trying it i loved it so much i bought one for me to in black. She loves this camera and uses it all the time. the use of wifi is very convenient for her and she even has it synced to her computer to download directly to it when its close enough to it.

Reviews.Title: thought I was in love..... talk about a bad break up
Reviews.Author: charlie's momma
Reviews.Content: Got this camera because we were about to have a baby and loved the wifi feature. Couldnt use it in the hospital at all! Used it for maybe the first 3 months of her life and then the flash and shutter decided to take about a minute or longer to respond if they even would respond. Put it in its hard proof case and left it. 2yrs now I decided I want to try it again. Charged it, shutter started working so much better had it out for 5minutes and now the lens won't zoom back in and it won't turn on. Just keep recieving an error message. Awesome I should've added the extra little bit and bought a dslr camera! Please don't waste your money its not going to last and its not worth the wifi capabilities!

Reviews.Title: WI Fi is useless, touch screen is the worst
Reviews.Author: Les
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the WIFI backup feature and it's useless.  It connects to my WIFI network but it won't find the computer running the server.  The popup menus are difficult to understand, the error messages are useless and the support articles on the website are written by someone whose first language isn't English and they are also useless.  When you try to get the backup software connected to your WIFI network, it asks for the password for you network and even though it finds the network and connects, when it doesn't find your PC it boots you all the way back to the WIFI network setup so you have to type your passwords in again.  Great, my password is long and difficult to type on the unresponsive touch screen and there is no way to see if you are typing your passwords in correctly and sometimes you type a letter and hear two beeps so you're not sure if you typed two of the same letter or not.The touchscreen is awful.  I have small fingers but I almost always touch two keys at the same time.  When you try to swipe to go left or right, it almost always selects an icon instead or you have to swipe two or three times to get it to do anything.I tried to update the firmware and followed the instructions on the support webpage for this model camera and it says to open the software and click "update firmware for the connected device" but an error pops up and says that the connected device is not supported.  Then I tried to update it manually by copying the software to the SD card but it complains about a bad filename.  I searched the support knowledge base for this camera and there was a post on there by someone describing the same problem and the response by the tech (in broken English) said that this method is only for support personnel and that all the files weren't available.  So does that mean I have to take the camera to an authorized dealer to update the firmware?Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Screen Breaks Easily, Second Time
Reviews.Author: T. Hicks "twah"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of years.  I bought it originally on Ebay.  Within a few weeks the screen broke.  One minute I had it in my pocket and everything was fine.  When I pull it out of my front pants pocket the screen was broken.  I returned it to the seller who graciously replaced the screen.  I have been careful with it since.  I keep it in a case.  I just returned from a trip and had it in a case in a shoulder bag.  The screen is broken again.  It must my bad luck.  I have never had any problems with previous digital cameras.  The fact that it is touch screen and the glass may be extremely thing must be the cause.  I would not recommend this camera.As others say it is a little slow deciding what mode it wants.  Trying to get to the flash to work was a problem.Try another camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my wedding and I absolutely love it. The only issues I have is it freezes every once in a while while reviewing the pictures and wont go back to taking pictures without shutting it off and back on. But thats not that big of a deal. I also just moved in with my inlaws for 2 months until our apartment is ready and they have a bunch of wild boys in the house still. My cord (which is the charger and the cord to get the pictures) went missing within a day of being here. I have no way of charging it or getting my pictures from vacation. I tried a mini usb cord from walmart and that seemed to be to big still but barely. I do not like that there seems to be no way to replace a lost cord because its an odd size and the memory card is an odd size as well. I would simply just put it in the regular card it came with so I could get the pictures but, all my stuff is somewhere in storage. I would kinda like to have a charged camera when my baby is due in five weeks.Other than that... I love the camera. It has lots of great features, all the the night feature sucks. Its pointless, it doesn't really work well at all.

Reviews.Title: Tool for the photographically challenged
Reviews.Author: BobK
Reviews.Content: Really easy to set up, the camera is touch screen driven. While the touch screen can be a bit picky, sometimes requiring multiple pokes, it gets the job done without a lot of angst (or need to know much about cameras). The camera has all sorts of adjustments and settings for the accomplished photographer, for people like me with a photographic IQ lower than my shoe size, it has an AUTO setting that turns the camera into a high quality point and shoot. An 8GB micro SD card gave me more than 2600 full resolution pictures.With all of the different editing and filtering built into the camera, I can modify a single kitty photo to make as many as fifty alternate and artistic versions to post for internet kitty lovers everywhere. The AC adapter charges the camera through a proprietary USB cable also used to communicate with a PC. The camera can also be set up to back up the photos in the camera to your PC wirelessly, in addition to being able to email images, post them to Facebook or upload them to YouTube. I bought a Wasabi Power charger and battery pair for the camera, giving me three batteries and a way to fast charge batteries without tying up the camera. For its small size it gives a lot of utility and very crisp and clear photos with excellent color representation.I would have given five stars had the touchpad been a little more responsive. The hit n miss performance can be annoying. But it all other areas, the camera shines.

Reviews.Title: A good casual camera
Reviews.Author: N. Loi
Reviews.Content: It's your basic point and shoot, with some on-camera features that alter your photo and video taking, so I won't go too much into those.  The big seller of this camera is the Wifi, and I have to say it's pretty functional but not great.  The camera puts caps on the photo and video (320x240 and 30 seconds, stills are 2MP or less), so when you upload anything to Facebook or Youtube, it will be relatively limited.  The Wifi pops on and off when you need it, so uploading photos isn't quite as instantaneous as a smartphone.  It doesn't allow you to configure new locations to upload to, so you are pretty much limited to photobucket and Facebook and Picasa.  Flickr is absent from the lineup.The other thing I've noticed about this camera is its rather poor video recording quality.  The video is fine, but the audio is barely audible, even when imported to a computer to be watched.  For the price I had, it's nice to have a compact point and shoot which allows me to upload a few photos to Facebook or my email when needed.  It was also a hassle to upgrade the firmware, having to go through the program and hookup to a computer to upgrade the July 2011 firmware.  You'd think a wifi camera could upgrade directly to Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...if you're a hacker..
Reviews.Author: S. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself back in November since I'm doing a lot of sightseeing all over Colorado. I'm a techie and love all the tech features of it, particularly the direct uploads via wifi. I bought the camera as a gift for my sister, and while it shot pictures and video just fine, none of the wifi upload features worked. It would *constantly* fail to connect to the server. Also, most of the screens were completely different on this camera vs mine. Luckily, I hack phones and tablets all the time, so I wasn't afraid to try to update the firmware.It turned out that the camera shipped with significantly newer firmware than the very latest available via the Samsung support site. Not only that, but the firmware update tool refused to downgrade the camera's firmware to the latest version available for download. I had to manually download the firmware package, pull the files out and place them on an SD card in just the right way to force the camera to downgrade the firmware. Luckily it worked on the first try, and that corrected all of the issues. It's as if Samsung either shipped a bunch of these cameras with the wrong firmware installed or shipped with an alpha or beta version that was nowhere near ready for the general public. My sister is lucky I'm good with this stuff, because she was pretty bummed that such a nice camera was so broken out of the box.I contacted the seller after solving the issues, and they were very receptive and appreciative of my detailed feedback. I doubt they're going to downgrade all of their cameras in inventory or swap them out with Samsung, but I just can't lie awake at night wondering what they're going to do to resolve this.Would have given 1 star if I wasn't such a geek. The one I bought in Target has worked perfectly since day one.

Very bad in low light, seriuoslyI'm saying all this because I had to resell the camera after 2 months of using it.........to take pictures go for Canon, Nikon or Pentax. Now on the other side this camera is great for uploading low STD quality pictures and videos ti the web, great for bloggers.Thanks.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!  NO space for pictures without separate SD card!
Reviews.Author: krtaylor
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know most digital cameras come with very limited disk space; you're expected to buy a separate SD card if you want to take more than a handful of pictures.What I did not know is that this camera comes with NO space whatsoever.  None.  Zilch.  Nada.  Well, OK, it must have **something** in order to boot up and run I suppose.  But there's not enough to take a picture, which is what matters.I really only need to take a handful of photos at a time, so I figured I could do without an SD card.  Wrongo - there's not even enough room for ONE, I just get an error message.Lame.  Nothing against the camera, it seems pretty nice so far as I could tell.  If only I could take pictures with it... but no, I have to order another part before I can even try the thing.  Bah.

Reviews.Title: Not Twitter (TwitPic) Friendly
Reviews.Author: Byte Monkey "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the intention of being able to upload photos to TwitPic via WiFI using the email function but was highly disappointed when I discovered that you can't edit the subject line of the emails that it sends out.For anyone who has ever used any of the photo services for Twitter, you'd know that text in the subject line is what they used to create your captions. As it stands, the camera uses the spammy phrase "[User] has sent you a message!" as the email's subject line and that is what is posted as your caption online.All in all, the has lots of potential. For anyone who uses Facebook, the camera would probably work well for you since it has built-in uploader for that. I don't use Facebook so I can't vouch for effectiveness of that function.
